fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Jira cloud migration assistant migrates the custom field type *Project picker (single project)* containing the custom field value of the same project.
Cross-project key values are not migrated automatically or reported during the precheck or post-migration report.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create project A
# Create project B
# Create a custom field type *Project picker (single project)* assign it to both project A, B and to all screens
# Create issue1 on project A with custom field type *Project picker (single project)* referring to project A
# Create issue2 on project A with custom field type *Project picker (single project)* referring to project B
# Migrate project A and project B together (or) Project A alone to cloud site using Jira cloud migration assistant.
# Jira cloud migrates only the issue1 custom field containing the value of (Project A key). Issue2 migrates without any custom field value.


h3. Suggested Solution
JCMA should provide a post-migration report that custom field values containing the different project keys are not migrated.
JCMA should migrate the custom fields of both projects when project A and project B migrated altogether.

h3. Workaround
Migrate the rest of the projects if they are not migrated.
Import the missing data using CSV file.
fields.summary: JCMA to migrate custom field Project picker (single project)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We came across an error which is causing failure during migration and has impacted multiple customers while using JCMA and C2C Beta tool. The error would look like this -
{code:java}
ERROR ABC project-import We couldn't import Workflow 'Workflow Name'. Reason: IllegalArgumentException: DIRECTED transition with ID [xxx] should have at-least 1 source. This caused xxxx other items to fail.{code}
On digging further, we could see that a transition with this ID is present in the XML export of the workflow (steps to export - [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-and-export-issue-workflows/) |https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-and-export-issue-workflows/).]but the same transition is no where seen on the workflow UI (neither text nor diagram form).

This happens for both
 * Server to cloud 
 * Cloud to Cloud migration

*Steps to Reproduce*

No fixed way to replicate since this happens for both C2C Beta as well as Server to cloud JCMA migration.
h3. Expected Results

Migration should complete successfully or there should be a way to prevent these workflow corruptions.
h3. Actual Results

Error - 
{noformat}
IllegalArgumentException: DIRECTED transition with ID [2] should have at-least 1 source  {noformat}
h3. Workaround

*(i) Important* - Take backup before any change on Database level 
{quote}*Server to Cloud -*
Identify the impacted workflow and request user to share XML for the workflow => Get the exact error message from from JCMA error logs or c2c logs => Get the ID => Trace the impacted Transition => Either ask the user to create a fresh workflow without using copy operation OR remove that code piece from XML and import it to create fresh workflow = > Make changes in the project settings and attach the correct one.
{quote}
!Screenshot 2021-12-07 at 8.53.09 PM.png|width=517,height=29!
{quote}*Cloud to Cloud -* 

Since importing an XML to create a workflow in cloud is not a simple process, we may have to request the customer to manually create a workflow with same transition and replace it in existing project OR run an update command in the database to replace the current XML.
 * To do so, edit the XML of current workflow and remove the corrupt transition 
 * Look for impacted workflow in jiraworkflows table
 * 
{code:java}
update jiraworkflows set descriptor = 'CORRECT XML' where id = 'XXXX' returning *; {code}
for the concerned workflow
{quote}
fields.summary: Frequenty occurring error during migration - IllegalArgumentException: DIRECTED transition with ID [x] should have at-least 1 source

fields.description:
One the customer as the directory configuration is set up in such a way that JCMA pulls 57380 users from the entire AD.
 * Out of this 57380, around 27K is invalid emails and 25K is duplicate emails.

 * we could tombstone the invalid user and merge duplicate emails, after this, we’re still left with 31195 users. Out of these 31195 users, only 4671 users are licensed users.

 * Can we have an option in JCMA to migrate users only from licensed users or selected groups? along with JSM customers. 
This will be a huge advantage and avoid unnecessarily account creation on the cloud.
fields.summary: Can we have an option in JCMA to migrate users only from licensed users or selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JCMA doesn't migrate 'Project automation rules' while migrating JSM projects and only migrates the legacy automation rules
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate JSM project with both Project automation rules and legacy automation rules using JCMA
 # Project automation rules will not be migrated to the cloud

h3. Expected Results

Project automation rules should be migrated to the cloud
h3. Actual Results

Project automation rules fails to migrate to cloud
h3. Workaround

Project automation can be manually migrated using [import-and-export-jira-automation-rules|https://support.atlassian.com/cloud-automation/docs/import-and-export-jira-automation-rules/]
fields.summary: Project automation rules are not migrated using JCMA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61571].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When performing a CSV Import, the only issue links that can be created are in the form of Outward Descriptions (eg. X blocks Y). However, there is no way to link in the form of Inward Descriptions (eg. X is blocked by Y). This is a hassle for users who wants to import new issues through CSV that have inward description links to existing issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the user to pick whether the new links formed are in the form of Outward or Inward Descriptions.
fields.summary: CSV Importer should allow user to choose to import Issue links as Outward or Inward Description.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exporting JSM projects fail with a SQL Exception.
That exception is due to the field ‘SYSTEM_DECIDED’ used in a query and that field does not exist in “AO_56464C_APPROVAL” table. Turns out that this field was introduced in this table in JSD 3.9, as per [this link|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/SDSERVER/repos/servicedesk/browse/sd-components/approvals/approvals-plugin/src/main/resources/db/schema/ApprovalsDbSchema0001.yaml?until=50e7e7bae7e9352b1af1a01ea07a21fcb8a42fde&untilPath=sd-components%2Fapprovals%2Fapprovals-plugin%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fresources%2Fdb%2Fschema%2FApprovalsDbSchemaMaster.yaml], but on JSD 3.8 the error is raised.

JCMA minimum version only refers to Jira Core version 7.6.0 or later, but no minimum JSD version, so there is a possible gap where customers can install JCMA due to their Jira Core version, but cannot use JCMA due to an old JSD/JSM version. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JCMA on a Server instance with minimum version to Jira Core 7.6.0 or later, and JSM 3.8 or earlier.
# Try to migrate a JSM project.

h3. Expected Results
The migration is successful.

h3. Actual Results
The migration fails with a SQL Exception.

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA reports:
{noformat}
2021-11-26 11:06:20.238 ERROR <Project Key> project-export We couldn't export Servicedesk 1. Reason: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.servicedesk.api.queue.QueueQuery$Builder.serviceDeskId(I)Lcom/atlassian/servicedesk/api/queue/QueueQuery$Builder;.
2021-11-26 11:06:21.980 ERROR <Project Key> project-export We couldn't export Issue <Issue Key>. Reason: com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught SQLServerException for select "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."APPROVE_CONDITION_TYPE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."APPROVE_CONDITION_VALUE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."COMPLETED_DATE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."CREATED_DATE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."DECISION", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."ID", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."ISSUE_ID", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."NAME", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."STATUS_ID", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."SYSTEM_DECIDED" from "dbo"."AO_56464C_APPROVAL" "AO_56464C_APPROVAL" where "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."ISSUE_ID" = ?.
{noformat}

On atlassian-jira.log, you can see the full stack:

{noformat}
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught SQLServerException for select "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."APPROVE_CONDITION_TYPE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."APPROVE_CONDITION_VALUE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."COMPLETED_DATE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."CREATED_DATE", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."DECISION", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."ID", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."ISSUE_ID", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."NAME", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."STATUS_ID", "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."SYSTEM_DECIDED" from "dbo"."AO_56464C_APPROVAL" "AO_56464C_APPROVAL" where "AO_56464C_APPROVAL"."ISSUE_ID" = ?
...
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: Invalid column name 'SYSTEM_DECIDED'.
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException.makeFromDatabaseError(SQLServerException.java:258)
{noformat}

The root cause is that field 'SYSTEM_DECIDED' does not exist in the AO_56464C_APPROVAL table. 

h3. Workaround

Use JCMA for users/groups/agents and site import for data.
fields.summary: Using JCMA on JSM 3.8 or earlier raises a SQL Exception

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant to migrate Jira Core, Jira Software or Jira Service Management projects and issues, calls to the REST apis return HTTP 400 or HTTP 404 after migration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a Jira Service Management project with JCMA
 # Via Connect request
 ** {{[https://yoursite.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/search?jql=key%20in%20(ISSUE-1)&fields=id,key]}}
 ** {{[https://yoursite.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/project/${projectIdOrKey}|https://yoursite.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/search?jql=key%20in%20(ISSUE-1)&fields=id,key]}}

h3. Expected Results

The REST endpoints returns the expected data
h3. Actual Results

The REST endpoints return HTTP 400 (for search) or HTTP 404 (for project) with the message "Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it."
h3. Workaround

Uninstall and re-install the app and re-run the Connect side of the migration.
fields.summary: Jira projects and issues migrated with JCMA initially return HTTP 400 with REST call /rest/api/3/search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During the migration of a JSW project migration there was an error in JCMA error logs related to sprint custom field export while exporting an issue which failed other dependencies. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # One the custom field screen by opening this URL. http://<SERVER_HOSTNAME>/jira/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
 # Search for Sprint custom field. 
 # Select the Actions Gear for Sprint custom field and select Screens
 # Search for the following two Screens
 ## <PROJECT_NAME>: Scrum Bug Screen
 ## <PROJECT_NAME>: Scrum Default Issue Screen
 # Uncheck the check box against the two screens searched.

h3. Expected Results

Project should get migrated successfully. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
2021-10-25 21:05:30.678 ERROR <PROJECT_NAME> project-import We couldn't import Issue <ISSUE_ID> because of 1 missing dependencies: Custom Field 'Sprint'. This caused <X> other items to fail. Check the reasons for the missing dependencies on your server site.  {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Selecting the checkbox mentioned above against the two screens for a project will remove the issue and project export will succeed. 
 # <PROJECT_NAME>: Scrum Bug Screen
 # <PROJECT_NAME>: Scrum Default Issue Screen
fields.summary: Sprint custom file not getting exported during a JSW project migration

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Similar to [MIG-302: Add an option to stop a plan in JCMA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-302], allow JCMA to reset the state to remove all migrations and start again with a blank JCMA. This will help in situations where there are many running, but incomplete plans.

 !jcma-image.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Workaround
Please understand this is not recommended for production systems. This can be done with:
# Disable JCMA via UPM.
# Drop the database tables for JCMA. You can see which ones these are in admin → system → Plugin Data Storage and look for Jira Cloud Migration Assistant. They usually start with AO_6FF49D.
# Enable JCMA via UPM.
fields.summary: Option to reset JCMA back to default state

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User id [mapping|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/mappings/] is not available when user reference is stored in places not scanned by CCMA, e.g. in {{{}confluence_ContentEntityObject{}}}. This happens when *Migrate users related to the selected spaces* option is selected in CCMA. As a result, an app is unable to map the user id correctly in Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app that stores data in {{{}confluence_ContentEntityObject{}}}, e.g. [Scaffolding Forms & Templates|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/190/scaffolding-forms-templates]
 # Create a new user
 # Create page with a macro that stores data in {{{}confluence_ContentEntityObject{}}}.
If using Scaffolding Forms & Templates:
 ## Create a page with with User Options macro inside List Data
 ## Publish the page
 ## Click Edit Content and select the new user in user dropdown
 ## Click Save. You should see the new user being mentioned on page
 # Migrate the data. Select *Migrate users related to the selected spaces* option in CCMA
 # In Cloud, try to get user id mapping for the new user

h3. Expected Results

User id mapping should be available regardless of where user reference is stored.
h3. Actual Results

User id mapping is not available for data stored in certain places.
h3. Workaround

Select *Migrate all users* option in CCMA when migrating the data.
h3. Additional Details

The new user, who is only selected in the list, does not appear with a {{<object class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user" />}} entry in the Space export {{entities.xml}} file. They only appear as an entry in the {{BucketPropertySetItem}}, which isn’t a user object.

{code:xml}
<object class="BucketPropertySetItem" package="bucket.user.propertyset">
    <composite-id>
        <property name="entityName" type="string"><![CDATA[confluence_ContentEntityObject]]></property>
        <property name="entityId" type="long">65612</property>
        <property name="key" type="string"><![CDATA[~metadata.2]]></property>
    </composite-id>
    <property name="type">6</property>
    <property name="booleanVal">false</property>
    <property name="doubleVal">0.0</property>
    <property name="stringVal" />
    <property name="textVal"><![CDATA[<metadata>
 <entry>
 <string>
field-name</string>
 <list>
 <UserReference>
 <userKey>
ff8081817d548675017d5512cb8b0002</userKey>
 </UserReference>
 </list>
 </entry>
 <entry>
 <string>
field-name-2</string>
 <list>
 <UserReference>
 <userKey>
ff8081817d548675017d55132d590003</userKey>
 </UserReference>
 </list>
 </entry>
 </metadata>]]></property>
    <property name="longVal">0</property>
    <property name="intVal">0</property>
    <property name="dateVal" />
</object>
COPY TO CLIPBOARD 
{code}
fields.summary: User id mapping is not available for data stored in certain places

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On some Confluence cloud instances, the webhook calls ({{{}listener-triggered{}}}, {{{}app-data-uploaded{}}}) are duplicated several times and repeated over a period of three days.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This does not happen with all Confluence Cloud instances.
 # Register your Connect app for webhooks in the [Notification API|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/rest/api-group-notification-api/#api-webhook-get]
 # Perform a migration
 # Ensure a 2xx return is made within 10 seconds of receiving the webhook

h3. Expected Results

The webhook is called only once.
h3. Actual Results

The webhook (both {{listener-triggered}} and if included {{{}app-data-uploaded{}}}) are called at least once.
h3. Workaround

As documented in [Definitions of event attributes|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/events/#definitions-of-event-attributes] each webhook has a unique {{{}messageId{}}}, which can be used to confirm if a webhook message has already been received.
fields.summary: Webhook calls are duplicated in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Copy to Sandbox functionality will fail due to timeout if the database's tables are too large to export.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira environment with large tables
 # Create a Sandbox environment
 # Use the Copy to Sandbox feature
 # About 6-7 hours later, the copy will fail, and an email will be sent to the user of "We were unable copy data into your Jira Service Management at site-name.atlassian.net. Learn about why this may have happened, go to the sandbox page at admin.atlassian.com and try again, or contact us and we'll look into it."

h3. Expected Results

The Copy to Sandbox functionality continues to process the database and contents, then successfully ixports the contents.
h3. Actual Results

The process times out, and the data is not copied to the Sandbox environment.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Copy to Sandbox fails if the database tables are too large

fields.description:
Currently {{pom.xml}} for {{atlassian-app-cloud-migration-listener}} has no licence information in it, even though in the README.md file it has
{quote}License
Copyright (c) 2021 Atlassian and others. Apache 2.0 licensed, see LICENSE.txt file.
{quote}
and this links to LICENSE.txt.

The {{pom.xml}} should be updated with
{code:xml}
   <organization>
        <name>Atlassian</name>
        <url>https://atlassian.com/</url>
    </organization>

    <licenses>
        <license>
            <name>Apache License, Version 2.0</name>
            <url>http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0</url>
            <distribution>repo</distribution>
        </license>
    </licenses>
{code}
to ensure the [https://www.mojohaus.org/license-maven-plugin/] works correctly.
fields.summary: Add licence information to atlassian-app-cloud-migration-listener

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we import projects from Jira Data Center or Jira Cloud to *Jira Cloud* using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, the ranks of issues get duplicated, causing all sorts of problems.

One symptom of duplicated ranks is that issues cannot be ranked in the boards. The operation fails with an error:
!rank_error.png|thumbnail!

There might be all other sorts of issues due to this, not only this one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an new Jira Data Center server or a Jira Cloud site with a project and some issues
# Install JCMA
# Create an empty Jira Cloud instance as destination
# Migrate the project to destination Jira Cloud site using JCMA

h3. Expected Results
The projects are imported and ranks are not duplicated. Lexorank checks should be pass, as before importing:
!before_check.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Lexoranks are duplicate. Lexorank integrity checks show the error:
!after_check.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
Upon testing, we could replicate in a Jira Data Center -> Jira Cloud AND in a Jira Cloud -> Jira Cloud migration.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. If you need assistance, please contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Importing to Cloud using JCMA is duplicating issue ranks
